page.title: 06CHELFORD CATTLE MARKET cont.
page.content:
One old custom still in force is that of the seller paying the purchaser. The seller comes into the ring with his or her animal and holds up a pound or five pound note according to the value of the animal. This encourages the buyer and the successful buyer gets the money.
Here are some typical prices:- Friesian milk cow - Â£450-Â£520 5 year old Hereford bull 525 guineas In calf heifer - Â£320 In calf cow - Â£650 Average price of calf - Â£80-Â£120 Average price of rabbit _ 50p The 'guinea' (value Â£1.05) is still used in these transactions.
The animals and poultry are put in tiered cages and the auctioneer moves from cage to cage.
